title: Power property
text: If a is a real number, and $$m$$ and $$n$$ are whole numbers, then $${\left(a^m\right)}^n=a^{m n}$$. To raise a power to a power, multiply the exponents.
speech: If a is a real number, and  m  and  n  are whole numbers, then , parentheses a to the m-th  to the n-th is equal to, a raised to the m n power . To raise a power to a power, multiply the exponents.

are whole numbers, then  ,  a to the m-th  to the n-th is equal to, a raised to the m n power
. To raise a power to a power, multiply the exponents.

title: Use the power property
text: Using the power property to simplify the expression results in $$w^{12} w^{10}$$.
speech: Using the power property to simplify the expression results in , w to the twelfth w to the tenth .

title: Product Property for Exponents
text: Now, since the bases are the same, it is possible to simplify the expression by combining terms. Simply add the powers of the term that is being multiplied.
speech: Now, since the bases are the same, it is possible to simplify the expression by combining terms. Simply add the powers of the term that is being multiplied.
